channel.title: Math Fun
channel.description:
Solve the following differential equations and receive a prize;
Find the equation Z(x,y) given the differential equation dZ(x,y) = [y^2+Cos(x)]dx + [2xy + Sin(y)]dy = 0
hint: Use Partial derivatives
From [url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showpost.php?p=55309&postcount=2283']here[/url]
Solution [quote] px will be used as partial derivative dx will be used as derivative
[y^2+Cos(x)]dx + [2xy + Sin(y)]dy is in the form pZ/px * dx + pZ/py * dy = 0
Step 1] Lets see if this is an exact differential, so let us define two variables pZ/px = m = y^2 + Cos(x) pZ/py = n = 2xy + Sin(y)
Now if they are exact differentials then taking pM/py should equal pN/px
pM/pY = p/py(y^2) + p/py(Cos(x)) = 2y + 0 pN/pX = p/px(2xy) + p/px(Sin(y)) = 2y + 0
We have a winner, they are the same, so we can use the exact differential method to solve.
2] Lets integrate to find our function z with partial derivative with respect to x
Let z = integral of m * dx = integral of y^2 + cos(x) dx = xy^2 + sin(x) + H(y) = C1
3] H(y) is the left over junk from partial derivatives, so lets get rid of this
Lets use a partial derivative of xy^2 + sin(x) + H(y) with respect to y and set it equal to pZ/py(n) to find the derivative of H(y).
pZ/py = n = 2xy + Sin(y) = 2yx + H`(y) = 0 so H`(y) = sin( y )
integrate both sides with respect to dy to find H(y) = -cos(y) + C2
4] Lets insert H(y) back into the function and let C3 = C1 + C2
z = xy^2 + sin(x) - cos(y) = C3 [/quote]

item.title: Math Fun
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
ThePuddingMaster:

gotta re-learn all calculus and every part of a levels maths for my physics degree, without a calculator… :’(

You do not need a calculator for calculus other then when you need to find the exact value of your answer.

Verde Flash:

We just learned derivatives in Calculus today. I was actually EXCITED for math. Good day.

Oh, it gets more fun down the road when you learn the anti-derivative known as integrals.

Read full topic

Verde Flash:

We just learned derivatives in Calculus today. I was actually EXCITED for math. Good day.

I know, you had that sudden realization that math could be useful, like, with the rate something changes.

…You won’t get that rush with integrals. It’s just backwards.

item.title: Math Fun
item.dc:creator: Sky_Monster
item.description:
I see Mathematics as a key that will open doors, and once the doors are open I will toss the key aside into a fiery, acidic pool of toxic waste. I will rescue it before it burns up completely and then jump up and down on it. Then I will eat it, pass it through my digestive system and crap it out into the worlds filthiest toilet, which I will in turn explode with 1000 tons of TNT.

:jizz:

Read full topic

My mistake, I though that it was you who asked that question. And no, I don’t have any private update.
